name: claroty-xdome
label: Claroty XDOME
description: Claroty xDome is a modular, SaaS-powered industrial cybersecurity platform that scales to protect your environment and fulfill your goals as they evolve.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server_url
fields.tooltip: Specify the IP address or hostname of the Claroty XDOME to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.description: Specify the IP address or hostname of the Claroty XDOME to which you will connect and perform automated operations.

fields.title: API Token
fields.name: api_key
fields.tooltip: Specify the Bearer Token of your Claroty XDOME setup. To create an API user from Admin Settings > User Management, and generate an API token
fields.description: Specify the Bearer Token of your Claroty XDOME setup. To create an API user from Admin Settings > User Management, and generate an API token

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Alerts
operations.description: Retrieves the details of alerts corresponding to the Alerts table in the Claroty XDOME dashboard.

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify which fields to return for each Alert.
parameters.description: Specify which fields to return for each Alert.

parameters.title: Before Detected Time
parameters.name: before_detected_time
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time on which Alerts detected before that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z
parameters.description: Specify the time on which Alerts detected before that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z

parameters.title: After Detected Time
parameters.name: after_detected_time
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time on which Alerts detected after that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z
parameters.description: Specify the time on which Alerts detected after that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z

parameters.title: Before Updated Time
parameters.name: before_updated_time
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time on which Alerts updated before that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z
parameters.description: Specify the time on which Alerts updated before that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z

parameters.title: After Updated Time
parameters.name: after_updated_time
parameters.tooltip: Specify the time on which Alerts updated after that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z
parameters.description: Specify the time on which Alerts updated after that time will be fetched. Note: Provide time in %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ format, Ex: 2023-10-19T09:14:53.101000Z

parameters.title: IDs
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Alert ID you want to filter Alerts. One or more ID can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Alert ID you want to filter Alerts. One or more ID can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Category
parameters.name: category
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Alert category you want to filter Alerts. One or more category can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Alert category you want to filter Alerts. One or more category can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Filter By
parameters.name: filter_by

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.tooltip: Specify how the returned data should be sorted, If more than one sort clause is passed, additional clauses will be used to sort data that is equal in all previous clauses. Default value is [{"field":"id","order":"asc"}]
parameters.description: Specify how the returned data should be sorted, If more than one sort clause is passed, additional clauses will be used to sort data that is equal in all previous clauses. Default value is [{"field":"id","order":"asc"}]

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the Alerts. Default value is 0
parameters.description: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the Alerts. Default value is 0

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum amount of Alerts to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000
parameters.description: Specify the maximum amount of Alerts to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000

parameters.title: Fetch all Alerts
parameters.name: all_alerts
parameters.tooltip: Specify if you want to fetch all the alerts from Claroty XDOME. Limit parameter will be ignored if this parameter is checked
parameters.description: Specify if you want to fetch all the alerts from Claroty XDOME. Limit parameter will be ignored if this parameter is checked

operations.title: Get Devices
operations.description: Retrieves the details of Devices corresponding to the Devices table in the Claroty XDOME dashboard.

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify which fields to return for each Device.
parameters.description: Specify which fields to return for each Device.

parameters.title: Device Type
parameters.name: device_type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device type you want to filter Devices. One or more Device type can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the device type you want to filter Devices. One or more Device type can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: MAC OUI
parameters.name: mac_oui_list
parameters.tooltip: Specify the vendor of the device's NIC (according to the OUI MAC) you want to filter Devices. One or more MAC OUIs can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the vendor of the device's NIC (according to the OUI MAC) you want to filter Devices. One or more MAC OUIs can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Model
parameters.name: model
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device model you want to filter Devices. One or more Device model can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the device model you want to filter Devices. One or more Device model can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Software/Firmware Version
parameters.name: software_or_firmware_version
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device software or firmware version you want to filter Devices. One or more Device software or firmware version can be provided in a comma separated format. Note: All Versions should be in captial Ex V5.1.3
parameters.description: Specify the device software or firmware version you want to filter Devices. One or more Device software or firmware version can be provided in a comma separated format. Note: All Versions should be in captial Ex V5.1.3

parameters.title: Device Category
parameters.name: device_category
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device category from which you want to filter devices
parameters.description: Specify the device category from which you want to filter devices

parameters.title: Device Sub-Category
parameters.name: device_subcategory
parameters.tooltip: Specify the device subcategory from which you want to filter devices
parameters.description: Specify the device subcategory from which you want to filter devices

parameters.title: Purdue Level
parameters.name: purdue_level
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Device Purdue level with which you want to filter Devices
parameters.description: Specify the Device Purdue level with which you want to filter Devices

parameters.title: Vulnerabilities
parameters.name: known_vulnerabilities
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Known Vulnerabilities you want to filter devices.
parameters.description: Specify the Known Vulnerabilities you want to filter devices.

parameters.title: Risk Score
parameters.name: risk_score
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Risk Score you want to filter devices
parameters.description: Specify the Risk Score you want to filter devices

parameters.title: Filter By
parameters.name: filter_by

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.tooltip: Specify how the returned data should be sorted, If more than one sort clause is passed, additional clauses will be used to sort data that is equal in all previous clauses. Default value is [{"field":"uid","order":"asc"}]
parameters.description: Specify how the returned data should be sorted, If more than one sort clause is passed, additional clauses will be used to sort data that is equal in all previous clauses. Default value is [{"field":"uid","order":"asc"}]

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the Devices. Default value is 0
parameters.description: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the Devices. Default value is 0

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum amount of Devices to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000
parameters.description: Specify the maximum amount of Devices to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000

operations.title: Get OT Activity Events
operations.description: Retrieves the details of OT events corresponding to the events table in the OT Activity page in the Claroty XDOME dashboard.

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify which fields to return for each OT Event.
parameters.description: Specify which fields to return for each OT Event.

parameters.title: OT Event ID
parameters.name: event_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Event ID you want to filter OT Events. One or more Event ID can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Event ID you want to filter OT Events. One or more Event ID can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: OT Event Type
parameters.name: event_type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Event type you want to filter OT Events. One or more Event type can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Event type you want to filter OT Events. One or more Event type can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Destination Asset ID
parameters.name: dest_asset_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the  Destination Asset ID on which you want to filter OT Events. One or more Destination Asset ID can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the  Destination Asset ID on which you want to filter OT Events. One or more Destination Asset ID can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Source Asset ID
parameters.name: source_asset_id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Source Asset ID you want to filter OT Events. One or more Source Asset ID can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Source Asset ID you want to filter OT Events. One or more Source Asset ID can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Filter By
parameters.name: filter_by

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.tooltip: Specify how the returned data should be sorted, If more than one sort clause is passed, additional clauses will be used to sort data that is equal in all previous clauses. Default value is [{"field":"event_id","order":"asc"}]
parameters.description: Specify how the returned data should be sorted, If more than one sort clause is passed, additional clauses will be used to sort data that is equal in all previous clauses. Default value is [{"field":"event_id","order":"asc"}]

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the OT Events. Default value is 0
parameters.description: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the OT Events. Default value is 0

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum amount of OT Events to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000
parameters.description: Specify the maximum amount of OT Events to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000

operations.title: Get Vulnerabilities
operations.description: Retrieves the details of Vulnerabilities corresponding to the Vulnerabilities table in the Claroty XDOME dashboard.

parameters.title: Fields
parameters.name: fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify which fields to return for each Vulnerabilities.
parameters.description: Specify which fields to return for each Vulnerabilities.

parameters.title: Vulnerability ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Vulnerabilities ID you want to filter Vulnerabilities. One or more Vulnerabilities ID can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Vulnerabilities ID you want to filter Vulnerabilities. One or more Vulnerabilities ID can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Vulnerability name
parameters.name: name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Vulnerability Name designated by Claroty's Research team you want to filter Vulnerabilities. One or more Vulnerability name can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Vulnerability Name designated by Claroty's Research team you want to filter Vulnerabilities. One or more Vulnerability name can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: Vulnerability Type
parameters.name: vulnerability_type
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Vulnerability Type you want to filter Vulnerabilities. One or more Vulnerability Type can be provided in a comma separated format.
parameters.description: Specify the Vulnerability Type you want to filter Vulnerabilities. One or more Vulnerability Type can be provided in a comma separated format.

parameters.title: CVE ID
parameters.name: cve_ids
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Vulnerability CVE ID you want to filter Vulnerability. One or more Vulnerability CVE ID version can be provided in a comma separated format
parameters.description: Specify the Vulnerability CVE ID you want to filter Vulnerability. One or more Vulnerability CVE ID version can be provided in a comma separated format

parameters.title: CVSS V3 Score
parameters.name: cvss_v3_score
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version 3 score,Vulnerabilities greater or equal to that will be fetched.
parameters.description: Specify the Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version 3 score,Vulnerabilities greater or equal to that will be fetched.

parameters.title: Filter By
parameters.name: filter_by

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.name: offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the Vulnerabilities. Default value is 0
parameters.description: Specify the initial index of page from where to retrieve the Vulnerabilities. Default value is 0

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum amount of Vulnerabilities to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000
parameters.description: Specify the maximum amount of Vulnerabilities to fetch. Default value is 100. Limit can be set between 0 to 5000

operations.title: Execute Generic Claroty API
operations.description: Execute a generic Claroty API with the specified endpoint and parameters

parameters.title: Endpoint
parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.tooltip: Specify the URI endpoint of Claroty XDOME REST API that you want to execute
parameters.description: Specify the URI endpoint of Claroty XDOME REST API that you want to execute

parameters.title: Parameters
parameters.name: parameters
parameters.tooltip: Specify the JSON parameters that you want to send as request body to the given REST Endpoint. Note: The Request Method is set as 'POST'
parameters.description: Specify the JSON parameters that you want to send as request body to the given REST Endpoint. Note: The Request Method is set as 'POST'
